unicode.value: Situación de aprendizaje para inglés de 1º ESO. Se trabaja el texto descriptivo, el orden de los adjetivos y vocabulario diverso (ropa, complementos, actividades extraescolares y de tiempo libre, descripción física, personalidad y partes del cuerpo).

Hello, students!

In this first challenge, you are going to present your team.

You are also going to choose and describe your mascot!

Are you ready? 

Let's go!

Complete the main cover of your team notebook.

Your roles

What's your role?

  • Leader
  • Secretary
  • Facilitator
  • Manager

Find a logo

In "Our team" you are going to:

  • Create a mascot.
  • Describe yourselves and your mascot.
  • Present yourselves and your mascot to your classmates.

Before presenting your team or finding your new mascot,

you need to review some vocabulary.

Do you know the parts of the body?

They are important for a physical description!

a) Watch the following video in teams. 

b) Take turns to write and translate the parts of the body in your notebooks. Write as many words as you know.

Rotating page

Use this technique to write your words in English.

Time to practise

I am sure you know many of these words. Now it is time to practise with some activities. Ask your teacher!

Your challenge is here.

In teams, describe your mascot.

Then, individually, describe yourselves.

And finally, present to your classmates!

What evidence does the teacher need?

  • IN TEAMS: Mascot (drawing, text with its description and participation in the oral presentation) and coevaluation.
  • INDIVIDUAL: digital avatar, text with personal description and oral presentation.

1. Create your mascot

Use a piece of paper. You have examples here.

2. Design your avatar

You can do it online or using a piece of paper. You have examples here.

3. Write your mascot's description

Do this activity with your team. You have the structure here.

4. Write your personal description

Do this activity individually. You have the structure here.

5. Prepare your oral presentation

Here you have some tips for the oral presentation.

6. Do the oral presentation

And that's it!

Apoyo visual

OUR MASCOT MAX

My name is Max. I am from Hairy World and I am 235 years old. I go to the Mascot school and I am in Year 5. I live in a cave with my family.

I am short and very hairy. I have got thick eyebrows, short legs and orange fur. In the picture, I am wearing white and blue trainers and I have got a green and red umbrella.

I am very grumpy, but also adventurous. I like chess and learning new languages, and my favourite subject is P.E.

See you soon!

JOHN WARD

My name is John Ward. I am from Dublin (Ireland)and I am twelve years old. I go to Oxford boarding school and I am in year 7. I live there with my teachers and my classmates. 

I'm tall and slim. I've got dark short hair and my eyes are blue. In the picture, I've got glasses and I'm wearing a blue t-shirt and brown shorts. 

I am very friendly, and sometimes shy.  I like football, videogames and meeting friends, and my favourite subject is maths. 

I'm ready to work hard with my team this year!

Preferences

You can say:

I like videogames. I  like to play videogames. I like playing videogames.

He likes chess. He likes to play chess.  He likes playing chess.

FOURTH PARAGRAPH: CONCLUDING

MAX JOHN

Remember the paragraphs to write a good description:

Paragraph 1: Introduction

  • Name
  • City and country
  • Age
  • School
  • Grade
  • Residence
  • Lives with...

Paragraph 2: Physical description

  • Hair colour and length
  • Eye colour
  • Accesories
  • Clothes

Paragraph 3: Personality

  • Personality adjectives
  • Hobbies and preferences
  • Favourite subject

Paragraph 4: Conclusion

  • A concluding sentence

Order the paragraphs. Remember the structure of a description:

  • This is my friend Marie. She is 14 years old and she lives in Paris, France.
  • She lives with her aunt and two cousins and she is in Third Grade in Molière school.
  • She is blonde. Her hair is straight and her eyes are green. She always wears a hat.
  • My friend Marie is hard-working and nice, and she likes chess.
  • Marie is my best friend! I love her!

Check

Look at the following infographics. Do you know how to use adjectives?
Provide instruction on how the cloze activity should be completed. Default text will be entered if there are no changes to this field.
Read the words and write sentences in the correct order.
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.

1. hard-working / she / is

She is hard-working.

2. got / new / I've / book / a

I've got a new book.

3. schoolbag / his / green / is

His schoolbag is green.

4. eyelashes / black / her / are

Her eyelashes are black.

5. friendly / Susan / is

Susan is friendly.
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

1. hard-working / she / is

She is hard-working.

2. got / new / I've / book / a

I've got a new book.

3. schoolbag / his / green / is

His schoolbag is green.

4. eyelashes / black / her / are

Her eyelashes are black.

5. friendly / Susan / is

Susan is friendly.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.

Structure of the presentation

  • Start with an initial greeting:
    • Good morning, classmates!
    • Good afternoon and welcome to our presentation!
  • Introduce the team. Say the names of the participants and their roles:
    • This is the green team and there are four of us... Susan is our secretary.
    • Let us introduce ouselves: This is Peter and he is our manager.
  • Show your team's logo.
    • This is our logo. It's a...
    • As you can see, this is our logo. It's...
  • Take turns to describe your mascot. Show it to your classmates.
    • As you can see, this is our mascot. Its name is...
    • This is ... It's our mascot because...
  • Individually, describe yourselves. Show your avatars.
    • Use your writing but do not read.
  • Finish with a concluding sentence.
    • That's all. Thank you very much.
    • Thanks for listening.

Tips for a good presentation

  • Speak clearly and slowly.
  • Pronounce correctly. Ask if you don't know before presenting.
  • Watch your body language even if it is not your turn.
  • Look at the public.

Iniciarse en el conocimiento y la aceptación de la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia.Conoce y acepta la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia. (5)Conoce y en general acepta la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia. (4)Conoce y acepta algunos elementos de la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia. (3)Empieza a conocer y aceptar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia. (2)Le cuesta conocer y aceptar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística propia de países donde se habla la lengua extranjera, reconociéndola como fuente de enriquecimiento personal y mostrando interés por compartir elementos culturales y lingüísticos básicos propios y ajenos que fomenten la sostenibilidad y la democracia. (1)
6.3. Iniciarse en la aplicación, de forma guiada, de estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad.Aplica estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad. (5)Aplica normalmente, de forma guiada, estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad. (4)Aplica a veces, de forma guiada, estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad. (3)Empieza a iniciarse en la aplicación, de forma guiada, de estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad. (2)Le cuesta iniciarse en la aplicación, de forma guiada, de estrategias básicas para comprender, explicar y apreciar la diversidad lingüística, cultural y artística, usando la lengua extranjera como instrumento de intercambio cultural, atendiendo a valores ecosociales y democráticos y respetando los principios de justicia, equidad e igualdad. Comunicación:

- Presentación oral.

- Textos descriptivos.

Plurilingüismo:

- Diccionario.

- Reflexión sobre el aprendizaje (to be, have got, orden de los adjetivos).

Interculturalidad:

- Creación de mascotas.

- Sistema educativo anglosajón.

Contenidos previos:

  • To be.
  • Have got.
  • Partes del cuerpo: face, body, head, hair, etc.
  • Pronombres personales sujeto y objeto: I, my, he, him, etc.
  • Determinantes posesivos y pronombres posesivos: my, mine, you, yours, etc.
  • Pronombres y determinantes demostrativos: this, that, these, those.

Contenidos nuevos:

  • Adjetivos de descripción: personalidad y física
  • La ropa y los complementos.
  • Adjetivos delante del nombre.
